snippet: George Zimmerman’s new lawyer, Mark O’Mara, said self-defense would probably be a “facet” of the defense.
abstract: George Zimmerman makes his first court appearance since shooting teenager Trayvon Martin, accompanied by his new lawyer Mark O'Mara; O'Mara announces that his client will plead not guilty, and that self-defense under the Stand Your Ground Law will play a role in the case.

byline.original: By SERGE F. KOVALESKI and LIZETTE ALVAREZ
byline.contributor: Joseph Freeman contributed reporting from Sanford, Fla., and Kitty Bennett contributed research from St. Petersburg, Fla.

lead_paragraph: George Zimmerman’s new lawyer, Mark O’Mara, said self-defense would probably be a “facet” of the defense.

headline.main: A Day in Court and a New Lawyer for Defendant in Martin Case
headline.print_headline: Day in Court and New Lawyer for Defendant in Martin Case
